briefTitle: Hypofractionated Radiation Therapy in Preventing Recurrence in Patients With Breast Cancer After Surgery
officialTitle: A Phase III Trial of Hypofractionated Radiotherapy to the Whole Breast Alone After Breast Conserving Surgery
conditions: Stage I Breast Cancer AJCC v7
Stage IA Breast Cancer AJCC v7
Stage IB Breast Cancer AJCC v7
Stage II Breast Cancer AJCC v6 and v7
Stage IIA Breast Cancer AJCC v6 and v7
Stage IIB Breast Cancer AJCC v6 and v7
Stage IIIA Breast Cancer AJCC v7
summary: This randomized phase III trial studies how well hypofractionated radiation therapy works in preventing the return of tumor cells in breast cancer patients following surgery. Hypofractionated radiation therapy delivers higher doses of radiation therapy over a shorter period of time and may kill more tumor cells and have fewer side effects.

primaryOutcome.measure: Complication Rate, Defined as the Percentage of Women Who Develop Grade 3 or Higher Late Adverse Event and/or Deterioration of Cosmesis From Excellent/Good to Fair/Poor or From Fair to Poor
